result.execSummary:
The defendant Ceon L. Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ceon L. Hill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ceon L. Hill was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 3 days, if revoked.
No suspension of DL.
May transfer probation to Illinois.
****AMENDED JOC***   DNA sample and surcharge ordered 9/9/14****

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*****   DNA sample and surcharge ordered on 9/9/14 ****
May not have contact with Chris Booker or any known drug dealers.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No suspension of DL.  May transfer probation to Illinois.

DNA sample and surcharge ordered, JOC to be amended.
from Agent Erin Angel regarding error in the PSI report stating that DNA sample had been obtain.  Def. has now submitted to a DNA sample on 9/4/14.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1

Defendant, Ceon L. Hill, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Sentence:
Ct 1:
Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions; my transfer prob. to Illiniois.  3 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered, cash on deposit to be applied, remainder to poster.  No restitution requested.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  DNA sample and surcharge waived.  Appeal rights given.
PER 2014 JUDICIAL ROTATION ORDER OF KENOSHA COUNTY

Defendant, Ceon L. Hill, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Attorney Jason R Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:   Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel Poss Amp.-2nd, Repeater; found guilty by the court.  Ct 2 along w/10CM483 were dismissed outright.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  PSI report ordered.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Angela Komp. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-19-14 @ 10:30am. Bond continued.
